acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Its 96-hour LC50 is > 180 mg/L for fish (fathead minnow) (ECOTOX, 2007). As its water solubility is 0.000137 mg/L (SRC, 2005), classification is not possible based on these test results.

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the report that rabbit LD50 >= 8.0 g/kg (HSDB, 2003), the substance was classified into the "Not classified" category.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Since no mortality was observed in rats exposed to approx. 154 mg/L for 1 hour (HSDB, 2003), we determined that LC50 is > 154 mg/L (1 hour). The estimated LC50 for 4-hour exposure= 1 hour*(> 154 mg/L)/4 hours = > 38.5 mg/L. Consequently, using classification criteria for dust, the substance was classified into the "Not classified" category.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the report that rat LD50 = 8.76 g/kg (HSDB, 2003), the substance was classified into the "Not classified" category.

carcinogenicity.rationale: It is rated as "2A" by Japan Society for occupational Health (2007) and "2" by the EU (2007). Based on these ratings, the substance was classified into Category 1B.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term

explosives.rationale: It does not contain chemical groups (aliphatic azo group) associated with explosive properties.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: In treated rats, DNA adduct formation and DNA damage were observed (RTECS, accessed in October 2007), and mouse lymphoma test gave positive results (NTP DB, accessed in October 2007). However, these positive results are considered to not act as sufficient evidence in terms of reliability. Thus, classification is not possible due to insufficient test results available.

organic_peroxides.rationale: Organic compounds containing no bivalent -O-O- structure

oxidizing_solids.rationale: It is an organic compound containing oxygen (but not fluorine or chlorine), which is chemically bonded to sulfur. Since no test results based on standardized testing methods are available, classification is not possible.

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: May damage fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Mice were administered this substance at dose levels of 0, 50, 75, 100, or 200 mg/kg/day (administration route not provided) on days 6 through 15 of gestation, and a Cesarean section was performed on day 18 of gestation (HSDB (2003)). Decreased weight gain was observed in parental animals administered at 100 mg/kg/day or above, and cleft palates and wavy ribs were noted in the offspring administered at 75 mg/kg/day (HSDB (2003)). In this study, since malformations were observed in the offspring at doses that did not affect parental animals, the substance was classified into Category 1B.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: It does not contain chemical groups (aliphatic azo group) associated with explosive properties or those associated with self-reactive properties.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (liver)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: In a 13-week mixed diet administration test using rats, biliary hyperplasia was noted (NTP TR 108, 1978). Evaluating this report, we determined that the liver is the target organ of this substance, and this effect was seen at doses that fall under the range of Category 2 guidance values. Thus, the substance was classified into Category 2 (liver).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data. As additional background information, in rats administered single doses of the substance through forced oral administration, congestion of the lungs was reported (HSDB, 2003). Also there are other studies indicating adverse effects of this substance. However, these studies do not explain the relationship between doses and their effects. Consequently, classification is not possible based on these studies.
